name: administration
content:
administration

noun
 OPAL W
 
/ədˌmɪnɪˈstreɪʃn/
 
/ədˌmɪnɪˈstreɪʃn/
jump to other results
  1.  
    (also informal admin)
    [uncountable] the activities that are done in order to plan, organize and run a business, school or other institution
    • Administration costs are passed on to the customer.
    • the day-to-day administration of a company
    • I work in the Sales Administration department.
    see also business administration
    Extra Examples
    • The college loses a lot of money through poor administration.
    • A large part of his job involves routine administration.
    • They are gradually doing away with centralized bureaucratic administration.
    • Until now, she has been entirely responsible for the administration of the school.
    Topics Businessb2
    Oxford Collocations Dictionaryadjective
    • effective
    • efficient
    • good
    • …
    verb + administration
    • be in charge of
    • be responsible for
    administration + noun
    • costs
    See full entry
  2.  
    (often Administration)
    [countable] the government of a country, especially the US
    • during/under the… administration under the Trump administration
    • Successive administrations have failed to solve the country's economic problems.
    • A senior administration official has decided to step down.
    Extra Examples
    • He was Secretary of Education in Bush's first administration.
    • Her resignation is the second of a senior member of the administration within a month.
    • The current administration will remain in office until elections in November.
    • He continued as head of a caretaker administration.
    • the handover of sovereignty by the British colonial administration
    • the role of the UN in the setting-up of an interim administration
    Oxford Collocations Dictionaryadjective
    • colonial
    • federal
    • local
    • …
    verb + administration
    • form
    See full entry
  3. [uncountable] the management of public affairs synonym government (2)
    • under… administration The inhabitants of the island voted to remain under French administration.
  4. [uncountable] the process or act of organizing the way that something is done
    • the administration of justice
    Oxford Collocations Dictionaryadjective
    • effective
    • efficient
    • good
    • …
    verb + administration
    • be in charge of
    • be responsible for
    administration + noun
    • costs
    See full entry
  5. [countable] the people who plan, organize and run a business, an institution, etc.
    • university administrations
    Extra Examples
    • The hospital administration can refuse patients' access to their own records.
    • The prison administration is working hard to improve the service.
    • He has been in dispute with the New Zealand cricket administration.
    Oxford Collocations Dictionaryadjective
    • college
    • hospital
    • prison
    • …
    See full entry
  6. [uncountable] (formal) the act of giving a drug to somebody
    • the administration of antibiotics
    Topics Healthcareb2
    Oxford Collocations Dictionaryadjective
    • intravenous
    • oral
    • drug
    • …
    See full entry
  7. [uncountable] (British English, Australian English, law) a situation in which the financial affairs of a business that cannot pay its debts are managed by an independent administrator
    • If it cannot find extra funds, the company will go into administration.
    compare Chapter 11
    8. Word OriginMiddle English: from Latin administratio(n-), from the verb administrare , from ad- ‘to’ + ministrare ‘wait upon’, from minister ‘servant’, from minus ‘less’.
See administration in the Oxford Advanced American DictionarySee administration in the Oxford Learner's Dictionary of Academic English

content:
business administration

noun

/ˈbɪznəs ədmɪnɪstreɪʃn/
[uncountable]
jump to other results
  1. ​the study of how to manage a business
    • a master’s degree in business administration (= an MBA)

name: the Drug Enforcement Administration
content:
the Drug Enforcement Administration

 
/ðə ˌdrʌɡ ɪnˈfɔːsmənt ədmɪnɪstreɪʃn/
 
/ðə ˌdrʌɡ ɪnˈfɔːrsmənt ədmɪnɪstreɪʃn/
(abbreviation the DEA)
jump to other results
  1. ​an organization established in 1973 to make sure that US drug laws are obeyed. It is part of the US Department of Justice. The DEA especially tries to stop drugs entering the country. It works closely with the FBI, the US Customs Service and the United States Coast Guard.
Check pronunciation: the Drug Enforcement Administration

name: the Federal Aviation Administration
content:
the Federal Aviation Administration

 
/ðə ˌfedərəl eɪviˈeɪʃn ədmɪnɪstreɪʃn/
 
/ðə ˌfedərəl eɪviˈeɪʃn ədmɪnɪstreɪʃn/
jump to other results
  1. ​FAA
Check pronunciation: the Federal Aviation Administration
nearBys: the Federal Bureau of Investigation noun

name: the Federal Housing Administration
content:
the Federal Housing Administration

 
/ðə ˌfedərəl ˈhaʊzɪŋ ədmɪnɪstreɪʃn/
 
/ðə ˌfedərəl ˈhaʊzɪŋ ədmɪnɪstreɪʃn/
(abbreviation the FHA)
jump to other results
  1. ​the US government organization that was started in 1934 to allow more people to buy houses. The FHA provides insurance for mortgages and is part of the Department of Housing and Urban Development.
Check pronunciation: the Federal Housing Administration

name: the Works Progress Administration
content:
the Works Progress Administration

 
/ðə ˌwɜːks ˈprəʊɡres ədmɪnɪstreɪʃn/
 
/ðə ˌwɜːrks ˈprɑːɡres ədmɪnɪstreɪʃn/
(abbreviation the WPA)
jump to other results
  1. ​a US government programme (1935-43) established by President Franklin D Roosevelt as part of his New Deal. Its name was later changed to the Works Projects Administration. It created millions of jobs for unemployed people during the Great Depression, mainly in building and the arts.
Check pronunciation: the Works Progress Administration

name: the National Archives and Records Administration
content:
the National Archives and Records Administration

 
/ðə ˌnæʃnəl ˌɑːkaɪvz ən ˈrekɔːdz ədmɪnɪstreɪʃn/
 
/ðə ˌnæʃnəl ˌɑːrkaɪvz ən ˈrekərdz ədmɪnɪstreɪʃn/
(abbreviation NARA)
jump to other results
  1. ​the US government agency that is responsible for the country's official collection of historical records, documents, papers, films, maps, etc. They include the original Declaration of Independence, the American Constitution and the Bill of Rights. The National Archives Building is in Washington, DC, on Constitution Avenue.
Check pronunciation: the National Archives and Records Administration
nearBys: the National Archives and Records Administration
the National Assembly for Wales noun

name: the Occupational Safety and Health Administration
content:
the Occupational Safety and Health Administration

 
/ði ˌɒkjupeɪʃənl ˌseɪfti ən ˈhelθ ədmɪnɪstreɪʃn/
 
/ði ˌɑːkjupeɪʃənl ˌseɪfti ən ˈhelθ ədmɪnɪstreɪʃn/
(abbreviation OSHA)
jump to other results
  1. ​a US government organization that protects the safety and health of workers. Its officers visit work places and can punish companies for low standards. It also informs the public about possible risks at work, such as the use of dangerous materials. OSHA was set up in 1971 after the Occupational Safety and Health Act was passed in 1970, and is part of the US Department of Labor.
Check pronunciation: the Occupational Safety and Health Administration
nearBys: the Occupational Safety and Health Act
the Occupational Safety and Health Administration
